subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Big Mistake!
author: Rj

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Frank =E2=80=93 thanks for participating in the test discussions.



I am n=
ot running the tests, but I am going to try to participate, even if it is o=
nly giving my input, as much as I can. =C2=A0I envision =E2=80=9CObjective =
Listeners=E2=80=9D to be people who are not trying to prove, or disprove, t=
he theories either way. I envision the tests being developed to help them b=
e objective: for example, maybe one group of people ask questions, but a di=
fferent group listen to the recordings without knowing the questions, and t=
ry to hear the answers. =C2=A0Maybe that would help control for questions l=
eading what you hear (for example, asking a YES/NO question might predispos=
e someone to hearing a YES or NO in the noise). =C2=A0While everyone may he=
ar different, maybe they won=E2=80=99t. =C2=A0Maybe a large enough group of=
 people will show a higher percentage giving one answer over another. =C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0Any if no one hears the same thing, that could also be signi=
ficant, and raise the question how anyone could have any confidence that wh=
at they hear, is what is on the
 tape? =C2=A0I think these are all interest=
ing possibilities, hence my interest in the tests.



You are probably righ=
t that there are supposed objective scientists out there, and those adherin=
g to their own dogma over pure science. I think that is a potential failing=
 of people in general: religious people can focus on dogma over reason, sci=
ence can focus on dogma over reason, believers can focus on dogma over reas=
on, skeptics can focus on dogma over reason. =C2=A0Left alone, they don=E2=
=80=99t grow out of this. =C2=A0That=E2=80=99s why it is always important, =
for those who understand the dangers of this kind of close-minded dogma, to=
 support testing and critical thinking, and to involve themselves in tests =
to not only challenge traditional beliefs, but challenge beliefs of their o=
wn.



So I thinks it=E2=80=99s great that you and all of us here are parti=
cipating in these discussions, and that you=E2=80=99ve gone the extra mile =
to support this testing by lending your box to the researchers. =C2=A0And o=
f course, the more people who are informed with the workings and potential =
of this technology being involved, the better the test environment will be,=
 and the less chance for subjective-errors to creep in. =C2=A0The better th=
e tests, the better the chance that theories and beliefs that are wrong, wi=
ll be shown to be wrong. And those that are right, shown to all to be right=
.



Again, I will be sure to keep everyone informed, and hope that anyone =
else who wants to participate will do so. 



=C2=A0








--- On Tue, 1/=
5/10, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: Frank Sumpti=
on <purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Big Mistake!
To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, January 5, 2010, 8:02 AM







=C2=A0

=


  


    
      
      
      =C2=A0So who certified these "objective" li=
steners in these supposed tests? Everyone hears different, and I doubt havi=
ng some degree means you get perfect hearing. Even everyday stuff like musi=
c lyrics, everyone hears different, why aren't these skeptics out there kee=
ping people from buying records? 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0That's pure BS about trying=
 to save people from wasting money and time. I don't know what the motivati=
on is, but I suspect it has more to do with science dogma, than pure scienc=
e. It's like we are all supposed to to get some bozo's permission to do our=
 investigations, and research has to be approved by some university.=C2=A0I=
 say bite me!

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I dared to question the motivation and methods =
of these supposed objective scientists and was accused of attacking them, l=
ike how dare I even question their authority! I'm supposed to supply my equ=
ipment for debunking and not even ask how it will=C2=A0 be tested, or what =
qualifies these bozos to test anything? 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I've said all along =
that you can't take everything from the boxes as gospel, and you do in fact=
 hear what you want to hear at times, but these pompus jerks act like I'm=
=C2=A0the one out there fooling everyone. =C2=A0These science dorks want on=
e thing, they want the boxes to go away because it does in fact show that t=
here is more to life than the physical and we are=C2=A0in fact more that so=
me stupid accident as they would have us believe. There is very strong moti=
vation for science to show the box is nothing, as with all things paranorma=
l. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Why is is ok for them to lie in the name of science!?=C2=
=A0 When they say "there is no evidence" that is a lie!
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Frank-=
S
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
